thread.title: Deciding what counts as 'fake news' cannot be a job for Parliament
thread.title_full: Deciding what counts as 'fake news' cannot be a job for Parliament

author: Philip Johnston
title: Deciding what counts as 'fake news' cannot be a job for Parliament
text:
I have a confession. I once faked the news. Not, I hasten to add, in this newspaper, but when I worked on a college publication more years ago than I care to remember. To mark a particular anniversary and to get people to buy the rag, we “splashed” on a manufactured story about fictitious goings-on at the university so sensational that we sold out in minutes. Only when the readers turned to an inside page did they discover it was all a fabrication. What larks!
Unfortunately, the editor of the local newspaper read no further than the front page and dispatched a reporter to investigate. His towering disdain when he discovered what we had done lives with me to this day.
F ake news is hardly a modern phenomenon . We used to call it disinformation and it has been deployed by rulers and their opponents since the dawn of time. History is littered with carefully crafted counter-narratives to justify...
